short_summary: The Correctional Service of Canada requires third party certification training for offenders in Standard First Aid and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated External Defibrillator (AED).
description: To provide third party certification in Standard First Aid and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated External Defibrillator (AED) training to groups of offenders at various institutions and Community Industries in Alberta, Manitoba and Saskatchewan.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Vocational Training for First Aid and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a qualified supplier to provide vocational training services for Correctional Officers and offenders in various correctional institutions and community industries in Alberta, Manitoba, and Saskatchewan. The training will be in First Aid and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated External Defibrillator (AED).

**Services Required:**

* Issuance of standardized first-aid and CPR training certificates to eligible participants
* Provision of qualified training instructors to conduct classroom and practical training sessions
* Delivery of comprehensive training materials and equipment to each training location
* Certification of participants in accordance with administratively established guidelines

**Submission Requirements:**

The successful bidder will be required to submit a comprehensive proposal outlining their approach to deliver the training services, including the following:

* Outline of the proposed delivery structure and calendar for the required training services
* Technical proposal with specific details on training methodology, instructional strategies, and resources to be used
* Pricing and pricing methodology for the required services
* Detailed resume of the coordinator or instructor who will be responsible for the implementation of the training services
* Adequate insurance and relevant certifications demonstrating their ability to meet CSC standards

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* Proposal approach and delivery structure (max 30 points)
* Technical proposal, including methodology, instructional strategy, and resource utilization (40 points)
* Pricing methodology and overall prices (20 points);
* Past experience and records of successful delivery of similar services (10 points)

**Eligibility:**

Potential bidders are required to fulfill the pre-qualification criteria identified in the complete RFP document. All bidders must confirm in their submission that they can meet these criteria.

**Timeline:**

The selected bidder(s) will be required to deliver the training services to the specified locations by November 30th, 2024, with an option to renew for two additional one-year periods.

**Technical Requirements:**

Bidders must ensure that their proposal clearly addresses the following Canadian standards:

* Required certificates for successful participants
* Technical training material
* Needed equipment for instructors

**Language of Submission:**

The bidders may submit their proposal in either official language of Canada (English or French).
